Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/8817674217604665
  • Última atualização do currículo em 08/03/2019

Doutor em Astrofísica pelo Instituto de Astronomia, Geofísica e Ciências Atmosféricas da Universidade de São Paulo (IAG/USP), com um ano de doutorado sanduíche no exterior no Observatório Europeu do Sul (ESO) em Santiago, Chile. Atualmente pós-doutorando na Universidad Andres Bello (UNAB, Chile), dentro do programa do ESO fellowship, após um pós-doutorado na Durham University (Inglaterra) dentro da rede LACEGAL/Marie Curie. Líder do VISCACHA survey, membro dos surveys VVVX e GOTHAM. Responsável pelo instrumento FORS2 no VLT, ESO de 2015 a 2018. Experiência em astrofísica estelar no contexto de formação e evolução de galáxias, trabalhando principalmente nos seguintes tópicos: aglomerados globulares, populações estelares, bojo e halo da Via Láctea, múltiplas populações em aglomerados globulares e Nuvens de Magalhães. Experiência com instrumentação astronômica, telescópios, operações, administração, trabalho em equipe unindo astrônomos e engenheiros. Membro da Sociedade Astronômica Brasileira (SAB) e da Sociedad Chilena de Astronomia (SOCHIAS). Para mais informações, favor acessar: www.sc.eso.org/~bdias (Texto informado pelo autor)

Linhas de pesquisa
1.
Aglomerados de estrelas
Objetivo: Determinação de idade, metalicidade média, distância, avermelhamento, massa, parâmetros estruturais via fotometria. Determinação de parâmetros atmosféricos e abundâncias químicas de estrelas individuais em aglomerados via espectroscopia..
Setores de atividade: Pesquisa e desenvolvimento científico.
2.
Nuvens de Magalhães
Objetivo: Desvendar a história das Nuvens de Magalhães por meio de seus aglomerados de estrelas. Entre os objetivos específicos, estão: construção de uma mapa 3D dos aglomerados, revelando a profundidade de algumas regiões como a contrapartida da ponte de Magalhães; determinação do histórico de formação e destruição de aglomerados estelares; definição da evolução química para cada região; caracterização de gradientes radiais de idade e metalicidade; verificação de como os parâmetros estruturais variam com a distância ao centro da galáxia; identificação de aglomerados que perderam muitas estrelas possivelmente devido a forças de maré, etc. Projeto VISCACHA..
3.
Múltiplas populações em aglomerados globulares
Objetivo: Busca por aglomerados com dispersão de metalicidade estrela a estrela; caracterização de casos raros com variação nas abundâncias estelares de Carbono e Oxigênio; comparação de fotometria ultra violeta e visível com espectroscopia de baixa e alta resolução para identificar aglomerados globulares anômalos..
4.
Abundâncias químicas de estrelas em aglomerados globulares
Objetivo: Nova escala de metalicidade para aglomerados globulares da Via Láctea; projeto GOTHAM..
5.
Bojo da Via Láctea
Objetivo: Estudo das populações estelares do Bojo; estrutura do Bojo; descoberta de novos aglomerados de estrelas; projeto VVVX.


Projetos de pesquisa
2019 - Atual
Spectroscopic confirmation of new globular cluster candidates in the Milky Way bulge.
Descrição: We propose to perform GLAO-assisted MUSE observations of 17 new globular cluster candidates projected towards the Milky Way bulge. These objects were recently discovered by using the deep near-IR photometry provided by the VVV survey. The confirmation and characterisation of these low luminosity clusters in the bulge is important in order to complete the census of the Galactic globular cluster system, and would also enable a number of interesting follow-ups. Based on our experience with MUSE observations of bulge fields, a single pointing on each cluster candidate provides radial velocities for more than 700 stars, thus allowing to kinematically confirm or reject their cluster nature. In addition, for each candidate cluster, the spectra of the observed brightest red giants and red clump stars will provide Fe, Mg and Ca abundances, hence the first measurements of the clusters metallicity and [α/Fe] trend..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Coordenador / Geisler, D. - Integrante / Dante Minniti - Integrante / PALMA, TALI - Integrante / FERNÁNDEZ-TRINCADO, JOSE G. - Integrante / GÓMEZ, MATÍAS - Integrante / M. Chijani - Integrante / M. Gregg - Integrante.
2018 - Atual
Chemical fingerprints to reconstruct the origins of unexplained giant stars
Descrição: Using new proprietary APOGEE data, we have discovered several (12 new unexplained giant stars) metal-rich ([Fe/H] > -1. dex) giant field stars that show enhanced Al and N accompanied by decreased C abundances and atypical Mg underabundances, indicating an unique chemical paern among Milky Way stars and whose origin is not known. e Mg-deficiency suggest that these atypical stars could have an extragalactic origin and former second-generation stars of dissolved extragalactic globular clusters or exotic binary systems are among the several scenarios proposed so far. We propose to use the FEROS spectrograph in order to measure the abundances of heavy neutron-rich elements (e.g., s- process elements like Zr, Tc, Y, Nb, and La; not accessible with APOGEE), which will permit us to unveil the origin of these atypical stars. is will be a major step forward to understanding the formation and evolution of our own Galaxy..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Integrante / Geisler, D. - Integrante / FERNÁNDEZ-TRINCADO, JOSE G. - Coordenador / Olga Zamora - Integrante / Sandro Villanova - Integrante / Baitian Tang - Integrante / Ronald Mennickent - Integrante.
2018 - Atual
Disentangling the complex chemical evolution of the SMC with GMOS: the counter-bridge
Descrição: The evolution and structure of the Magellanic Clouds is currently under debate. The classical scenario where both Large and Small Magellanic Clouds (LMC, SMC) are orbiting the Milky Way has been challenged by another where the LMC and SMC are in their first close passage to our Galaxy. Stellar population studies in these key nearby galaxies can constrain the proposed scenarios. In particular, the SMC presents a complex chemical history as revealed by its stellar clusters. An efficient strategy to disentangle this complexity is to split the SMC stellar cluster system in at least four different spatial groups, three of them probably related to tidal stripping. The photometric analysis of stellar clusters in the SMC outskirts has suggested the presence of a metallicity gradient as well as an age-metallicity relation compatible with a burst model of chemical enrichment (Dias et al. 2014, 2016b, 2018a in prep). We have already probed the west halo with GMOS spectra (Dias et al. 2018b in prep.). We propose now a spectrocospic follow-up of 11 stellar clusters located in the SMC counter-bridge to fully characterise its anomalous V-shape metallicity gradient (Parisi et al. 2015, 2016). We plan to use the GMOS in the multi- object mode to collect spectra of red giants in the CaII triplet region. The data analysis will provide mean metallicities and radial velocities for these clusters with unprecedented accuracy (< 0.05 dex and < 3 km/ s)..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) .

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Coordenador / Geisler, D. - Integrante / PARISI, M. C. - Integrante / KERBER, L. - Integrante / Orlando Katime-Santrich - Integrante / Lilia Bassino - Integrante / Bruno de Bortoli - Integrante / BARBUY, B - Integrante / ANGELO, MATEUS S - Integrante.
2018 - Atual
The VISCACHA survey: disentangling the history of the Magellanic Clouds using star clusters
Descrição: The VISCACHA Survey is an ongoing Brazilian project based on deep and AO-assisted photometric observations of star clusters (SCs) in the Magellanic Clouds (MCs). Since 2015 > 200 hours of telescope time were used to observe 125 SCs, most of them with low mass and/or located in the outermost regions of the MCs. From this high-quality data, we determine ages, metallicities, reddening, distances, and structural parameters. The main goal is to build a 4D map (position, distance, age) of the history of the MCs imprinted in their SC system, in particular: (i) to derive age and metallicity radial gradients and age-metallicity relation for different SMC regions that are correlated with predicted tidal stripping; (ii) to look for the missing old and low-mass SCs in the LMC, believed to have been tidally affected; (iii) to characterise the radial trend of core radius and ellipticity of SCs in both MCs. We require 10 nights (~ 85h) to observe 50 key targets distributed in strategical regions that were not (or only partially) covered in the previous missions.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Integrante / Bica, E. - Integrante / KERBER, L. - Coordenador / João Francisco C. dos Santos Jr. - Integrante / BARBUY, B - Integrante / PIATTI, ANDRÉS E - Integrante.
2018 - Atual
e VISCACHA survey: disentangling the history of the Magellanic Clouds using star clusters
Descrição: e VISCACHA Survey is an ongoing Brazilian project based on deep and AO-assisted photometric observa- tions of ∼500 star clusters (SCs) in the Magellanic Clouds (MCs). Since 2015 >200 hours of telescope time were used to observe ∼100 SCs, most of them with low mass or located in the outermost regions of the MCs. From this high-quality data, we determine ages, metallicities, reddening, distances, and structural parameters. e main goal is to build a 4D map (position, distance, age) of the history of the MCs imprinted in their SC system, in particular: (i) to derive age and metallicity radial gradients and age-metallicity relation for different SMC regions that are correlated with predicted tidal stripping; (ii) to look for the missing old and low-mass (M∼104 Mo) SCs in the LMC, believed to have been tidally affected; (iii) to characterise the radial trend of core radius and ellipticity of SCs in both MCs. We require 6 nights to continue the survey, now with Chile on board.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Coordenador / KERBER, L. - Integrante / João Francisco C. dos Santos Jr. - Integrante / MAIA, FRANCISCO F S - Integrante.

Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Coordenador / Geisler, D. - Integrante / CARBALLO-BELLO, JULIO A. - Integrante / FERNÁNDEZ-TRINCADO, JOSE G. - Integrante / Baitian Tang - Integrante.
2018 - Atual
Globular clusters from IFU and comparison with MUSE data: the compact bulge cluster Terzan 9
Descrição: The bulge globular cluster Terzan 9 is a compact and probably very old object projected towards the Galactic bulge. It is among the clusters that we identified as a family of blue horizontal branch combined to a moderate metallicity of [Fe/H] = -1.0. We have obtained MUSE imaging and spectra with the MUSE spectrograph at the VLT-ESO. We were able to extract the spectra of over 600 stars, at a resolution of R = 4000, similar to the resolution of SIFS. The comparison of data from MUSE to SIFS is of great interest as as science verification, in particular for this group who has built SIFS. Besides, if the comparison of the resulting spectra is sucessful, it would open a door to the study of more difficult globular clusters in the Galaxy with SIFS. The MUSE data are reduced and under study: we already derived radial velocities, thus identifying member stars, and estimated their metallicities and Mg abundances from the MgI triplet lines and its region. The same methods will be applied to the SIFS data..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Integrante / Luciano Fraga - Integrante / BARBUY, B - Coordenador / Heitor Ernandes - Integrante / Bruno Castilho - Integrante / Clemens Gneiding - Integrante / Antonio Cesar de Oliveira - Integrante / Jacques Lépine - Integrante.
2017 - 2018
Accurate ages of fossil bulge globular clusters from deep NIR photometry
Descrição: Deep near infrared (NIR) images using multi-conjugate adaptive optics (MCAO) system have been providing unprecedented results concerning the last frontier in terms of Galactic clusters: the bulge globular clusters (GCs). Thanks to the exquisite angular resolution (FHWM ~ 0.1") and the low extinction in these wavelengths in comparison with visible light, now it is possible to build deep colour-magnitude diagrams (CMDs) for these clusters, reaching stars in the low main sequence (MS) even in their innermost regions. Taking the advantages of the GSAOI+GeMS in the NIR - currently the only operating MCAO facility worldwide - we aim at reaching 2-4 magnitudes below the MS turn-off (MSTO) (filters JKs) for six moderately metal poor bulge GCs ([Fe/H] <~ -1.0) with blue horizontal branches. These combined characteristics suggest that they are among the oldest clusters in the Galaxy. HST archive images will be used as the 1st-epoch reference frame to build proper motion cleaned CMDs. Accurate ages will be determined by means of statistical isochrone fitting techniques. Metallicities from high resolution spectroscopy and independet distances determinations from RR Lyrae stars will be used to better constraint the final age solutions..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (2) .

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Integrante / Sergio Ortolani - Integrante / KERBER, L. - Coordenador / BARBUY, B - Integrante / BICA, E - Integrante / OLIVEIRA, RAPHAEL A P - Integrante / SOUZA, STEFANO O - Integrante / Mattia Libralato - Integrante / Domenico Nardiello - Integrante.
2017 - Atual
VIsible Soar star Clusters from tApii and Coxi HuguA (VISCACHA) survey: chemodynamical evolution and tidal history of the Magellanic Clouds
Descrição: The VISCACHA (VIsible Soar star Clusters from tApii and Coxi HuguA*) Survey, born from the joint efforts of two experienced groups working on the LMC and SMC, is an observational campaign aiming to collect AO-assisted BVI photometry of stellar clusters and to homogeneously determine physical parameters from statistical analysis of colour-magnitude diagrams, radial density profiles, and luminosity functions. High quality data have been collected with SAMI, reaching I ~ 24 and FWHM ~ 0.4" (I). Since 2015 ~100 stellar clusters were observed, most of them with low mass (M < 10^4 Msun) and located in the outermost regions of the LMC and SMC. The main goal is to determine ages, metallicities, reddening, 3D distribution in order to use the star clusters as tracers of the chemodynamical evolution and tidal history of the Magellanic Clouds, as well as investigate the effect of the enviroment in the cluster's mass, stellar mass functio and structural parameters. In 2017B we intend to observe another 72 clusters strategically located in the outer LMC/SMC regions closest to each other.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Integrante / KERBER, L. - Coordenador / Francisco Maia - Integrante / João Francisco C. dos Santos Jr. - Integrante / BARBUY, B - Integrante / BICA, E - Integrante / PIATTI, ANDRÉS E - Integrante.
2017 - Atual
Abundances in the inner bulge globular clusters Palomar 6 and NGC 6355
Descrição: We propose to obtain FLAMES-UVES spectra, in the bulge globular clusters Palomar 6 and NGC 6355 that have [Fe/H]∼-1.0. For these we have approved Kepler-2 measurements, allowing to extract precise ages by combining the spectroscopic results proposed here with seismic data from Kepler-2. We also aim at a comparison of abundances in the RHB Pal 6, with the BHB clusters that we studied so far: HP 1, NGC 6522, NGC 6558, and now NGC 6355, all of them at the lower end of the Metallicity Distribution of the bulk of bulge stellar populations, at around [Fe/H]∼-1.0. To verify their similarities/differences, we need abundances in a sample of individual stars in order to: (a) verify Na-O anticorrelation; (b) map the scatter in the abundance ratios among heavy elements Y, Zr, Ba, La, Eu; (c) derive information with C, N, iron-peak and alpha-elements abundances. 2017 - Atual
Disentangling the complex chemical evolution of the SMC with GMOS
Descrição: The evolution and structure of the Magellanic Clouds is currently under debate. The classical scenario where both Large and Small Magellanic Clouds (LMC, SMC) are orbiting the Milky Way has been challenged by another where the LMC and SMC are in their first close passage to our Galaxy. Stellar population studies in the galaxies should constrain the proposed scenarios. In particular, the SMC presents a complex chemical history as revealed by its stellar clusters. An efficient strategy to disentangle this complexity is to split the SMC stellar cluster system in at least four different spatial groups, three of them probably related to tidal stripping process. We analysed V, B-V colour-magnitude diagrams (SOAR data) of stellar clusters in the SMC west outermost region (west halo) and suggested the presence of a disperse metallicity radial gradient as well as an age-metallicity relation compatible with a burst model of chemical enrichment (Dias et al. 2014, 2016b). Nevertheless, the typical uncertainty for photometric metallicities is sigma ~ 0.2 dex and we need precision better than sigma < 0.1 dex to determine the metallicity radial gradient, or to discard its existence. CaII triplet spectroscopic metallicities of red giant stars using GMOS are suitable for this purpose. We propose a spectrocospic follow-up of 10 stellar clusters located in the SMC west halo. The data analysis will provide metallicities and radial velocities for these clusters with unprecedent accuracy..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Bruno Moreira de Souza Dias - Integrante / KERBER, L. - Coordenador / Jose Hernandez-Jimenez - Integrante / Orlando Katime-Santrich - Integrante / BARBUY, B - Integrante / BICA, E - Integrante.
2016 - 2018
Chemical abundance anomalies in the globular cluster NGC 3201
Descrição: The paradigm that defines globular clusters has changed based on high-resolution observations in the last two decades. It is well-known that all globular clusters present a star-to-star variation of light-element abundances, such as the Na-O anticorrelation (e.g. Gratton et al. 2004, 2012). This revolution is related to a CN-CH anticorrelation previously detected using low-resolution spectroscopy (e.g. Kayser et al. 2008; Smolinski et al. 2011). The most probable scenario to explain the anticorrelations is self-enrichment, where the polluters are the big open question of this field. AGB stars with 4-5 solar masses and fast-rotating massive stars with 20-100 solar masses are the most discussed candidates, but no conclusive answer has been found so far. M 22 is a peculiar cluster that has a CN-CH correlation instead (e.g. Norris & Freeman 1983). This cluster is one of a small group of clusters that also has a star-to-star [Fe/H] spread. Mucciarelli et al. (2015a,b) showed that M 22 and NGC 3201 have no [Fe/H] spread against previous findings. Interestingly M22 is a controversial cluster in terms of CN-CH relation and [Fe/H] spread. NGC 3201 may be another contentious cluster with a peculiar CN-CH. In this project we propose to observe spectra of RGB stars in NGC3201 in the blue region to derive Lick indices CN and CH and check whether [Fe/H] spread peculiarities could be related to CN-CH relation peculiarities..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Star clusters in the outer regions of the Small Magellanic Cloud
Descrição: The evolution of the Magellanic Clouds is presently under debate. The classical scenario where both Large and Small Magellanic Clouds (LMC, SMC) are orbiting the Milky Way has been challenged by another where the LMC and SMC are in their first close passage to our Galaxy. Stellar population studies in the galaxies should constrain the proposed scenarios. We have shown using SOI/SOAR data that west halo clusters exhibit age and metallicity radial gradient that constrasts with other regions of the SMC (Dias et al. 2014, 2016b). The interpretation is that this group was segregated from the main body by tidal forces. The other external regions wing/bridge and counter-bridge seem to have gradients as well based on heterogeneous and incomplete set of parameters from the literature (Dias et al. 2016b). More data is needed to complete the sample. We propose to observe 30 star clusters in the outer regions of the SMC with SOI and SAM to characterise the radial gradients and tidal interactions..

A MUSE study of the inner bulge globular cluster Terzan 9: a fossil record in the Galaxy
Descrição: Terzan 9, projected at only 4.12, and orbit remaining confined in the inner 1 kpc of the Galaxy center (Rossi et al. 2015b), is among the most central globular clusters in the Milky Way. A metallicity of [Fe/H]≈-2, and [Fe/H]≈-1.2, were derived from Ortolani et al. (1999), and Valenti et al. (2007), from Colour-Magnitude Diagrams, respectively: therefore derivation of metallicity is a primary goal. If [Fe/H]≈-2, this will be the lowest metallicity cluster in the bulge (and oldest). If [Fe/H]≈-1.2, it would be similar to the Blue Horizontal Branch clusters HP 1, NGC 6558, NGC 6522, and AL 3. It is the last unstudied spectroscopically among such clusters in the inner 5◦. Our recently carried out proper motion cleaning, provides identification of member stars (Rossi et al. 2015a), with astrometric precision coordinates. Given its compactness, we propose to observe it with MUSE, in order to derive metallicities and [Mg/Fe] based on the Mg2 feature (cf. Dias et al. 2015)..

2015 - 2018
The first detailed abundance analysis of giant stars in the metal-rich globular cluster NGC6366
Descrição: NGC6366 is the fifth closest Galactic globular cluster and no high-resolution spectral analysis is available for it yet. We propose to use ESPaDOnS/CFHT to obtain, for the first time, high-resolution (R = 68,000) and moderate S/N optical spectra to perform chemical tagging of the metal-rich globular cluster NGC6366. Observations have shown that while every well-studied globular cluster displays large star-to-star abundance variation in their light elements (O, Na, Mg an Al), these variations have never been observed in field stars. Thus, detailed chemical abundances for 30 elements in NGC6336 will place strong constraints on the origin of multiple stellar populations in globular clusters as well as allowing us to constrain the formation timescale of the Galactic halo, bulge and thick-disk components..

Projeto VISCACHA
Descrição: O projeto VISCACHA tem por objetivo observar imagens profundas e com alta resolução espacial sem precedentes dos aglomerados de estrelas das Nuvens de Magalhães, usando o telescópio SOAR. Abundances in the inner bulge globular cluster NGC 6558: possibly contains two stellar populations
Descrição: Proper motion cleaned V vs V-I Colour-Magnitude Diagrams (CMDs) of NGC 6558 appear to show a double red giant branch (RGBs). If confirmed, this would be the lowest mass globular cluster so far, for which multiple stellar populations are detected. It has a blue horizontal branch (BHB), combined with a metallicity of [Fe/H]≈- 1.0, similarly to HP 1 and NGC 6522, therefore probably among the oldest objects in the Galaxy. Metallicities will be derived for stars in the two parallel RGBs, together with abundance ratios of α (O, Mg, Si, Ca, Ti), light (C, Na, Al), iron-peak (Mn, Cu, Zn), s- (Ba, La, Y), and r- elements (Eu). The metallicity [Fe/H], and Na vs. O behaviour will be the main discriminators between different stellar populations. FLAMES+UVES is requested, allowing to observe ∼7 stars with UVES, and another ∼100 stars with GIRAFFE: identification of member stars is made possible from the proper motion criterion, and FORS2 low resolution spectroscopy..

Abundances in the inner bulge globular cluster HP 1: a fossil record in the Galaxy
Descrição: HP 1 is projected at only 3.33 from the Galactic center, therefore among the most central globular clusters in the Milky Way. It has a blue horizontal branch (BHB), combined with a metallicity of [Fe/H]≈-1.0, similarly to NGC 6558 and NGC 6522, therefore probably among the oldest objects in the Galaxy. 2013 - 2016
Star clusters in the west halo of the Small Magellanic Cloud
Descrição: The most reasonable scenario for the Small Magellanic Cloud (SMC) star cluster formation regards interaction with Large Magellanic Cloud and Milky Way (Bekki et al. 2004 a,b). Reconstruct this history is not an easy task, since there a bunch of tidal structures related to the SMC: Stream, Bridge, Counter-Bridge, and Leading Arm, detect by gas observations. The possible stellar counterparts of these structures may give further information on the SMC evolution, in particular, star clusters are useful tools since they provide information on age, metallicity, and distance at the same time. From Dias et al. (2013 in prep.), it was found out that the western group (West Halo) of clusters indicate gradients of age and possible in metallicity, which is a natural consequence of a tidal stripping of these objects. We propose to follow the photometric (BV) observations of unstudied West Halo clusters to derive age, metallicity, and distance, and look for a gradients, in a total of 17 objects (among a total of 31 in the region). The results will be constraints for evolution models for the SMC..

2012 - Atual
Searching for metallicity dispersions in globular clusters of the outer halo and Galactic bulge
Descrição: We carried out so far 1/3 of our project of medium-resolution spectroscopy of stars in distant or heavily reddened Galactic globular clusters (20 of a total 60 clusters were observed). To complete our project, we will use FORS2 to measure both the NIR Ca II triplet lines and the optical Fe+Mg lines for about 10-20 red giant stars per cluster. The goal is to search for clusters with abundance ranges (like NGC 5824, revealed by our group) to further explore the possible origin of such clusters as the nuclei of disrupted dwarf galaxies, but equally important aims are: (1) to derive metallicities on a homogeneous scale for clusters which are too distant (or reddened) for high-resolution studies as well as for Ca triplet spectroscopy at 4m class telescopes; (2) to construct indicators of the alpha-element enhancement based on a calibration of medium resolution observations against the results of detailed abundance studies. This methodology will be the basis of abundance ranking of extragalactic stars..

BVI optical photometry of 4 intermediate-age stellar clusters in the Small Magellanic Cloud
Descrição: In the present proposal we intend to observe 4 relatively bright stellar clusters in the SMC with 3 optical filters. There is very little information about these 4 clusters so far, but they are suspected to be intermediate-age clusters (3-10 Gyr). It means that they can provide important constraints in the age-metallicity relation during a period when the Magellanic Clouds probability evolved almost isolated and for which there is an almost absence of stellar clusters in the LMC. Colour-magnitude diagrams (CMDs) will be built for each object and its neighbouring field. By means of CMD modelling and statistical comparisons between model and data we will determine the fundamental physical parameters (age, metallicity, distance, mass function, etc) for each cluster and recover the star formation history for its local field population..

2007 - 2010
4 candidates for dissolving stellar clusters in the LMC "age gap"
Descrição: The rich cluster system in the Large Magellanic Cloud (LMC) shows a clear age gap in the range 3-10 Gyrs, with just one known exception (ESO121-SC03). However, an important question would be: are there dissolving stellar clusters in the LMC with ages in this so-called age gap? We propose to address this question by taking SOI images of 4 poorly populated (N < 1000 stars) LMC clusters previously identified, based on integrated colors, as clusters with ages between 3 and 10 Gyrs. Images in BVI filtres will be obtained to build colour-magnitude and colour-colour diagrams for these objects, reaching V~24.5, around 2 magnitudes below the oldest expected turn-off point. The confirmation of any of these clusters as an age gap cluster would provide new and important constraints for the chemical enrichment and dynamical evolution of the LMC..

2006 - 2007
BVI optical photometry of 5 stellar clusters in the SMC
Descrição: In the present proposal we intend to observe 5 relatively bright star clusters in the Small Magellanic Cloud with 3 optical filters. Colour-magnitude and colour-colour diagrams will be built for each object and modelled according to detailed techniques already developed and previously applied by our group, resulting in fundamental physical and structural parameters. There is very little information about these clusters available so far. Inspection of their DSS images reveals different structural characteristics (see Fig. 1): Lindsay 72 (NGC 376) is a rich globular cluster, Lindsay 3 is compact and fairly rich, HW1, AM3 and Lindsay 2 are of lower mass, the latter being relatively sparse. Integral spectra have been previously obtained for three of them (AM3, HW1 and Lindsay 3) by us and suggest intermediate or old ages for these systems. The observations will provide and important test to the SOAR/SOI resolution capabilities in dense stellar fields..
